results.title: Vivaldi's Venice
results.brief_description: Six 18th century concerti of Vivaldi sustain the sensuous poetry of the camera as it reflects Venice’s glories and variety of moods through Vivaldi’s, The 4 Seasons - Winter-Autumn Concerto. (Award: “Osella D’Argento” 30th International Exhibition of Cinematographic Art, Venice, August 1969)

results.title: Viva Zapata! [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Darryl F. Zanuck and Elia Kazan
results.brief_description: This dramatisation of the role of the peasant leader Emilio Zapata in the Mexican Revolution was the product of a close collaboration between screenwriter John Steinbeck and director Elia Kazan. Zapata (played by Marlon Brando), an ambiguous historical figure, is idealised in the film yet a certain psychological complexity is maintained. He is a symbolic figure, a ‘natural’ leader who is attuned to the essential needs of the people. Revolution thus becomes a natural rather than a revolutionary process. The weak idealist, Madero, cannot make the revolution work. The shadowy figure of Fernando, the advisor, stands as a symbol for Stalinism. Cast also includes Jean Peters, Anthony Quinn, Joseph Wiseman and Arnold Moss.

results.title: Viva Las Vegas = Love in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Jack Cummings and George Sidney
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley stars as racing car driver Lucky Jackson, a man determined to win the Las Vegas Grand Prix and triumph over his number one competitor, Count Elmo Mancini (Cesare Danova). The Count is like Lucky in many respects, a determined, thrillseeking ladies man, which makes defeating him even more difficult. To finance his vehicular obsession (and to purchase the most important item - the engine), he performs as a singing waiter, thus giving Elvis the chance to demonstrate his crooning and hip swinging capabilities. The task proves harder than first thought due to the distraction of sexy swimming instructor Rusty Martin (Ann-Margaret), as Lucky faces the prospect of losing love as well as the race. Elvis’ fourteenth movie includes hits such as “The Lady loves me”, “What’d I say”, “C’mon everybody” and “Viva Las Vegas”. Cast also includes Cesare Danova, William Demarest and Nicky Blair. Contains the original theatrical trailer.

results.title: Viva Falantil!
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, Campbell Manderson and SKA TV
results.brief_description: Report on a group of performers and activists who stowed away on a UN flight bound for East Timor to raise awareness of the plight of the Falintil people and their 20 year struggle against the East Timorese military. A tour through a newly-independent East Timor, still shell-shocked and facing an uncertain future. This story examines the possibilities for and obstacles to building a democratic nation. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Vitaphone Disc: Paramount Famous Lasky Corporation, "The Soul of France", Production Reel No.2929-3
results.brief_description: Vitaphone was a sound film system used for feature films and nearly 1,000 short subjects made by Warner Bros. and its sister studio First National from 1926 to 1931. Vitaphone was the last major analog sound-on-disc system and the only one which was widely used and commercially successful.

results.title: Vitamin C
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Michael Coyle
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Home Economics”
During the winter many of us suffer from a lack of Vitamin C. What foods are the best sources of Vitamin C and how can we preserve it in our cooking?
